entry.tran: 旗舰;(尤指指挥官所在的)主舰
entry.def: A flagship is the most important ship in a fleet of ships, especially the one on which the commander of the fleet is sailing.

entry.tran: 王牌;主打产品;旗舰产品
entry.def: The flagship of a group of things that are owned or produced by a particular organization is the most important one.

example.ex: The hospital has been the government's flagship, leading the health service reforms...
example.tran: 这家医院一直是政府的旗舰机构，引领着医疗服务的改革。

example.ex: The company plans to open a flagship store in New York this month.
example.tran: 公司计划本月在纽约开一家旗舰店。

means.word_mean: 1. the chief one of a related group;
2. the ship that carries the commander of a fleet and flies his flag
